title: Panthers' Barkov has broken hand
text:
Panthers' Barkov has broken hand 20-year-old forward could miss up to 2 months UPDATED 5:17 AM HST Oct 26, 2015 Photos Jim McIsaac/Getty Images 
Florida Panthers forward Aleksander Barkov missed Saturday's game with an injury, and the Florida Sun Sentinel reported Sunday that Barkov has a broken bone in his hand. Lewis Hamilton clinches third F1... 
It is unclear how long Barkov will be sidelined, with the Sun Sentinel report suggesting it could be anywhere from two weeks to two months. 
Barkov, 20, last played in a game on Thursday. He has three goals and three assists in his seven games this season. Last season he had 16 goals and 20 assists.
